intro: Monticalia iguaquensis, commonly known as the Iguassu mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic rainforests of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
